result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA]Case called at 2:28pm
Defendant Brandon Reed in court, in custody with Attorney Teri Strohschein.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court acknowledges receipt and review of sentencing transcript and revocation packet

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel


 The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1 serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail
--On Count #2: serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail concurrent to sentence in Count #1
--180 days credit for time already served given

Outstanding court costs are to be reduced to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:30am [mo]
Defendant Brandon Reed in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses and uncharged DA Case #13JE76 with DOV of 6/10-09/10 Charge: 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to pay $50 drug testing fee
--to pay statutory costs



Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 10:46am
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Mr. Reed verifies that the S Center Avenue address remains current.
